INFATUATION.Definition: strong feeling of being in love or obsessed with someone

EERIE.Definition: giving a feeling of unease or fear

NOTICE.Definition: become aware of or spot it

BULLET WOUND.Definition: injury caused by a bullet shot from a gun

BULLET.Definition: projectile or small metal object fired from a gun

HOUSEKEEPER.Definition: the person who managed and maintained the household

FOR THE SAKE OF EASE.Definition: for the purpose of simplicity or convenience

STARE.Definition: look steadily with eyes wide open

FLIRTATIOUS.Definition: behaving in a way that showed a romantic or sexual interest

SHORTAGE.Definition: state or condition of not having enough

WHIP.Definition: beat with a whip (strips of leather tied to a handle)

FIRED.Definition: dismissed from employment or a job

UP-AND-COMING.Definition: promising or likely to become successful or important in the future

BEYOND THE REALMS OF POSSIBILITY.Definition: too improbable or unlikely to be considered possible

MONSTROUS.Definition: extremely or shockingly evil or cruel

TENDENCIES.Definition: actions or behaviours that he was likely to follow

TWISTED.Definition: strange in an unpleasant way, perverted

CHAUFFEUR.Definition: a person employed to drive a private car for him

CHAPERONE.Definition: a person who accompanied and supervised her, a guard

SHRIEKING.Definition: making loud, high cries or sounds

BEAR.Definition: endure or carry the weight of it

SORROW.Definition: feeling of deep distress or sadness

HEARTBREAK.Definition: intense sorrow or sadness caused by a loss or disappointment

STAGE FRIGHT.Definition: fear or nervousness experienced by a performer before or during a performance

PARTIALLY.Definition: to a limited extent, not completely

UNLEASHED.Definition: released or set free with great force or intensity

RATIONAL.Definition: based on or in accordance with reason or logic

SEDATIVES.Definition: drugs or substances used to calm or cause sleep

IN COLD BLOOD.Definition: without any feeling of remorse or mercy

PLOT TWIST.Definition: unexpected turn or change of events in the story

ALIBI.Definition: piece of evidence or information that showed he was elsewhere during the event

TOOK MATTERS INTO THEIR OWN HANDS.Definition: took control or responsibility for it

RUMOURS.Definition: unverified information or stories spreading among people

EXPLICIT.Definition: clear and detailed in expressing ideas or intentions

EMBARRASSING.Definition: causing feelings of embarrassment or shame

SILENCED.Definition: suppressed or stopped her from speaking

RUTHLESSNESS.Definition: willingness to act without pity or mercy

FUNERAL.Definition: ceremony or service including her burial

SHINE.Definition: special area or display dedicated to honouring her

POST-MORTEM.Definition: examination of the dead body to discover the cause of death

SCANDAL.Definition: event or action that would cause public feelings of shock and anger

COVER-UP.Definition: attempt or try to hide or minimise the true facts or details of the event
